newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Lone bidder Americel eyes Brasilia cell concession.
newsitem.headline: Lone bidder Americel eyes Brasilia cell concession.

text.p: BRASILIA, June 4 (reuter) - Americel was the only consortium qualified to bid on a concession to run cellular B Band services in central western Brazil, including the country's capital Brasilia, said a group representative.
"We are extremely hopeful. We made a proposal which corresponded in every aspect with the demands of the bid specifications," said Gerard Vasquez.

The Americel consortium is comprised of pension funds, publicly owned Banco do Brasil, Opportunity Bank also of Brazil, Bell Canada, a unit of BCE Inc, Telesystem Telecom, also of Canada, and Citibank.
The concession area, known as area seven, also includes Goias state, and the Amazonian state of Acre, Rondonia and Tocantins.
The group also bid for area nine, made up of Bahia and Sergipe states, and area ten, which includes the rest of the northeast.
